result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Hess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  DNA specimen previously provided; surcharge only ordered.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment.  If chosen as trustee, to be afforded trustee credit.
Concurrent with: with time now serving.

Defendant Robert D Hess in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Robert D Hess in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
No 950 issues.  PSI reviewed by parties; no additions, 1 correction by defense (date of counseling).
State's offer and recommendation: imposed/stayed 4 yrs (2/2), 3 yrs probation.  No alc, controlled substances, RUAs, AODA; employment; counseling; 90 days RCJ  (in since 02/05/14)
Defense: probation revoked, MR Nov 2014. Request stay of 90 days RCJ or run concurrent with time now serving and with huber.
BTC:  4 yrs> 2 WPS, 2 ES imposed and stayed, 3 yrs probation consecutive to revocation now serving (per judge, off the record)

Defendant Robert D Hess in court with attorney Carolyn Delery.  Defendant Robert D Hess in custody.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert D Hess in court with attorney Carolyn Delery.  Defendant Robert D Hess in custody.  James D Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
